intro: Krukoviella scandens, commonly known as the climbing krukoviella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
